QUALIFIER.VALUE: Method to reset the error and warning counters. The method takes one parameter as input - an integer indicating which counter to reset. For this input parameter, 0 indicates all, 1 indicates a reset of the indeterminate error counter, 2 the critical error counter, 3 the major error counter, 4 the minor error counter and 5 the warning counter. The method returns 0 if successful, 1 if not supported, and any other value if an error occurred. A method is specified so that the LogicalDevice's instrumentation, which tabulates the errors and warnings, can also reset its internal processing and counters. In a subclass, the set of possible return codes could be specified, using a ValueMap qualifier on the method. The strings to which the ValueMap contents are 'translated' may also be specified in the subclass as a Values array qualifier.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: VideoBIOSFeature represents the capabilities of the low-level software that is used to bring up, configure and use a ComputerSystem's VideoController and Display.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any of the VideoBIOS features indicated in the Characteristics array. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Characteristics array that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of integers that specify the features supported by the VideoBIOS. For example, one could indicate support for VESA power management (value=6) or video BIOS shadowing (8). The value, 3, is not valid in the CIM Schema since in DMI it represents that no BIOS Features are supported. In this case, the object should not be instantiated.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: VideoBIOSElement represents the low-level software that is loaded into non-volatile storage and used to bring up, configure and access a ComputerSystem's VideoController and Display.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: If true, indicates that the Video BIOS is shadowed.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Date that this BIOS was released.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A class derived from RedundancyGroup indicating that one or more of the aggregated elements can be spared. (The actual Spares are defined using the ActsAsSpare association.) An example is the use of redundant NICs in a ComputerSystem - where one NIC is primary and the other is Spare. The 'primary' NIC would be a member of the SpareGroup (associated using the RedundancyComponent class) and the 'other' NIC would be associated using the ActsAsSpare relationship.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This method is forces a failover from one ManagedSystemElement to another. There are two parameters to the Failover method,FailoverFrom and FailoverTo. The FailoverFrom parameter is a reference to the primary ManagedSystemElement that will become inactive after the method. This Element should be associated with the SpareGroup through the RedundancyComponent relationship. The FailoverTo parameter is a reference to the ManagedSystemElement that will take over for the primary. This Element should be associated with the SpareGroup through the ActsAsSpare association. Once the failover has occurred, the SpareGroup and the RedundancyComponent and ActsAsSpare associations will be updated with current status. For example, the ActsAsSpare association that contained the FailoverTo Element will be deleted and a new RedundancyComponent association instantiated in its place. The method should return 0 if successful, 1 if the request is not supported, and some other value if any other error occurred. In a subclass, the set of possible return codes could be specified, using a ValueMap qualifier on the method. The strings to which the ValueMap contents are 'translated' may also be specified in the subclass as a Values array qualifier.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A class derived from RedundancyGroup containing mass storage-related redundancy information. StorageRedundancyGroups are used to protect user data. They are made up of one or more PhysicalExtents, or one or more AggregatePExtents. StorageRedundancyGroups may overlap. However, the underlying Extents within the overlap should not contain any check data.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: True indicates that the data is concatenated across the various StorageExtents in the Group.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: True indicates that the data is striped across the various StorageExtents in the Group.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: StorageRedundancy provides additional information on the state of the RedundancyGroup, beyond the RedundancyStatus property. Information like "Reconfig In Progress" (value=1) or "Redundancy Disabled" can be specified using this property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The TypeOfAlgorithm specifies the algorithm used for data redundancy and reconstruction. For example, "P+Q" (value=5) or "P+S" (7) may be specified. The value of 0, is defined as "None" to indicate that data redundancy is not active. An inactive redundancy should only be instantiated if data striping or concatenation are active. These are indicated by the IsStriped or IsConcatentated boolean properties of this RedundancyGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A class derived from RedundancyGroup indicating that the aggregated elements have more capacity or capability than is needed. An example of this type of redundancy is the installation of N+1 power supplies or fans in a system.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Boolean indicating whether load balancing is supported by the ExtraCapacityGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: MinNumberNeeded indicates the smallest number of elements that must be operational in order to have redundancy. For example, in an N+1 redundancy relationship, the MinNumberNeeded property should be set equal to N.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of the Printer LogicalDevice.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Describes all of the job sheets that are available on the Printer. This can also be used to describe the banner that a Printer might provide at the beginning of each Job, or can describe other user specified options.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of integers indicating Printer capabilities. Information such as "Duplex Printing" (value=3) or "Transparency Printing" (7) is specified in this property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any of the Printer features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Identifies the available character sets for the output of text related to managing the Printer. Strings provided in this property should conform to the semantics and syntax specified by section 4.1.2 ("Charset parameter") in RFC 2046 (MIME Part 2) and contained in the IANA character-set registry. Examples include "utf-8", "us-ascii" and "iso-8859-1".

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies which finishings and other capabilities of the Printer are currently being used. An entry in this property should also be listed in the Capabilities array.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the current character set being used for the output of text relating to management of the Printer. The character set described by this property should also be listed in CharsetsSupported. The string specified by this property should conform to the semantics and syntax specified by section 4.1.2 ("Charset parameter") in RFC 2046 (MIME Part 2) and contained in the IANA character-set registry. Examples include "utf-8", "us-ascii" and "iso-8859-1".

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indicates the current printer language being used. A language that is being used by the Printer should also be listed in LanguagesSupported.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the mime type currently being used by the Printer if the CurrentLanguage is set to indicate a mime type is in use (value = 47).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Identifies the current language being used by the Printer for management. The language listed in the CurrentNaturalLanguage property should also be listed in NaturalLanguagesSupported.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the paper type that the Printer is currently using. The string should be expressed in the form specified by ISO/IEC 10175 Document Printing Application (DPA) which is also summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies which finishings and other capabilities of the Printer will be used by default. An entry in DefaultCapabilities should also be listed in the Capabilities array.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of copies that will be produced for a single Job unless otherwise specified.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indicates the default printer language. A language that is used as a default by the Printer should also be listed in LanguagesSupported.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the default mime type used by the Printer if the DefaultLanguage is set to indicate a mime type is in use (value=47).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of print-stream pages that the Printer will render onto a single media sheet unless a Job specifies otherwise.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the paper type that the Printer will use if a PrintJob does not specify a particular type. The string should be expressed in the form specified by ISO/IEC 10175 Document Printing Application (DPA) which is also summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array providing supplemental information for the current error state, indicated in DetectedErrorState.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Printer's horizontal resolution in Pixels per Inch.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Printer jobs processed since last reset. These jobs may be processed from one or more PrintQueues.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array indicating the print languages natively supported.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the marking technology used by the Printer.

VALUE.ARRAY.VALUE: Impact Moving Head Dot Matrix Other

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The maximum number of copies that can be produced by the Printer from a single Job.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The maximum number of print-stream pages that the Printer can render onto a single media sheet.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the largest Job (as a byte stream) that the Printer will accept in units of Kbytes. A value of zero indicates that no limit has been set.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations of any mime types that are supported by the Printer. If data is provided for this property, then the value 47, "Mime", should be included in the LanguagesSupported property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Identifies the available languages for strings used by the Printer for the output of management information. The strings should conform to RFC 1766, for example "en" is used for English.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An integer array indicating the types of paper supported.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings specifying the types of paper that are currently available on the Printer. Each string should be expressed in the form specified by ISO/IEC 10175 Document Printing Application (DPA) which is also summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB). Examples of valid strings are "iso-a4-colored" and "na-10x14-envelope". By definition a paper size that is available and listed in PaperTypesAvailable should also appear in the PaperSizesSupported property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Status information for a Printer, beyond that specified in the LogicalDevice Availability property. Values include "Idle" (3) and an indication that the Device is currently printing (4).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Time of last reset of the Printer Device.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Printer's vertical resolution in Pixels per Inch.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of a Printer Queue. A PrintQueue holds PrintJobs - which are placed on the Queue by a PrintService. Jobs can move from Queue to Queue.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the job sheets that are supported by this Queue. Typically the job sheets provided by a Queue will be the union or aggregation of those provided by all the Printers that it supports. However, a system administrator may choose to restrict access to some job sheets on a particular Queue. A Queue might also support additional job sheets through the use of a filter that adds a banner or some other page when a Job is taken from the Queue.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the priority that will be assigned to a new Job being submitted to this Queue, if the Job does not explicitly specify a priority. The range of valid priorities and the interpretation of priorities may be determined from the JobPriorityHigh and JobPriorityLow properties.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the numeric value that is used to represent the highest priority Jobs that are submitted to this Queue. The range of numeric values for priority may be inversed, e.g. a high priority job is represented by a low integer value. This is indicated by JobPriorityLow being greater than JobPriorityHigh. If both values (PriorityLow and PriorityHigh) are assigned to zero, then the Queue does not support Job priorities.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the numeric value that is used to represent the lowest priority Jobs that are submitted to this Queue. The range of numeric values for priority may be inversed, e.g. a low priority job is represented by a high integer value. This is indicated by JobPriorityLow being greater than JobPriorityHigh. If both values (PriorityLow and PriorityHigh) are assigned to zero, then the Queue does not support Job priorities.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the largest possible Job (in terms of a single byte stream) that may be submitted to this Queue. A value of zero indicates that no limit has been set. Units are Kbytes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The current number of Jobs on the Queue.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: When FALSE, no PrintService can place PrintJobs on the PrintQueue. The ability of an individual PrintService to place a Job on the Queue can be specified using the QueueAcceptingFromService property in the QueueForPrintService association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indicates that Jobs on the Queue will be passed to a Printer. When FALSE, a Job will remain on the Queue and will not be passed to a Printer for output.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Gives Queue-specific status information, beyond the ManagedSystemElement.Status property. This may be used to provide further qualification as to the status of the Queue or to indicate a secondary condition (e.g. spool area is full).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Provides a textual explanation for the status of the Queue. The settings of both QueueStatus and the Status property inherited from ManagedSystemElement may be described by QueueStatusInfo. For example, if "Stopping" is the value assigned to Status, then this property may contain an explanation as to why the Queue is being stopped.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Description of a print request that is either waiting on a Queue for a Printer to become available, in the process of being output on a Printer, or that has previously been printed on a Printer. PrintJobs are weak to their current Queue, or to the last Queue that held them.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the character set and encoding method that should be used by the Printer for the management of this Job. The strings should conform to the semantics and syntax specified by section 4.1.2 ("Charset parameter") in RFC 2046 (MIME Part 2) and contained in the IANA character-set registry. Examples include "utf-8", "us-ascii" and "iso-8859-1".

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of physical copies of the output that will be produced from this Job.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of integers indicating the type of finishing required by this Job. It is equivalent to the Capabilities property provided by the Printer.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The horizontal resolution in Pixels per Inch for the Job.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Uniquely identifies this Job within its scoping Queue.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Provides additional information, beyond Job Owner inherited from CIM_Job, to identify the origins of the PrintJob. This property could include information such as the System, application or Process that created the Job.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the size of the PrintJob (as a byte stream) in units of Kbytes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The inherited JobStatus is used to provide additional information about the status of a PrintJob beyond that enumerated by PrintJobStatus.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the print language used by this Job.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the mime types used by the PrintJob if Language is set to indicate a mime type is in use (value=47).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Identifies the language that should be used by the Printer for the management of this Job. The specified value should conform to RFC 1766. For example, "en" is used for English.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of print-stream pages that should be rendered onto a single media sheet when the Printer outputs this PrintJob.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Describes the current state of this Job with respect to the PrintQueue and the Printer. Additional information may be specified in JobStatus.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Describes the job sheets that should be used when this Job is output on the Printer.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A string specifying the type of paper that is required by this PrintJob. Each string should be expressed in the form specified by ISO/IEC 10175 Document Printing Application (DPA) which is also summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB). Examples of valid strings are "iso-a4-colored" and "na-10x14-envelope".

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Provides additional textual descriptions of how this Job should be scheduled.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Time when this Job was completed. This value is only valid if the PrintJobStatus has been assigned to "Complete" (value=5) or "Completed With Error" (value=6).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The vertical resolution in Pixels per Inch for the Job.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ServiceAccessPoint for a printing Service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies the print procotols that this AccessPoint uses. Note that each entry of this array is related to the entry in the PrintProtocolInfo array that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Provides clarifying or additional information about the protocols supported by this AccessPoint. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the PrintProtocol array that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Service that provides support for printing. The basic assumption of the Printing Model is that a PrintService accepts a PrintJob for processing, via its PrintSAP. The Job is then placed on a PrintQueue (indicated by the QueueForPrintService association). Printers take Jobs from Queues (indicated by the PrinterServicingQueue association).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Describes the filters that are available within this PrintService. For example, a PrintService may be able to convert a Job submitted in one page description language to another, so that it can be passed to an available Printer.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of integers indicating the capabilities supported by this service. Information such as "Duplex Printing" (value=3) or "Transparency Printing" (7) is specified in this property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any of the Printer features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array indicating the print languages supported by the PrintService. A PrintService may support more languages than those available on the underlying Printer through the use of filters. An administrator may also choose to prevent some languages from being exported by the PrintService.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any mime types that are supported by the PrintService. Support for mime types is indicated by specifying a value of 47 in the LanguagesSupported array.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings specifying the types of paper that may be used by Jobs that are submitted to this PrintService. This may be different than the paper types that are installed on the Printer, because the PrintService may include support for manually making other types available or only a subset of paper types may be exported via this Service. Each string should be expressed in the form specified by ISO/IEC 10175 Document Printing Application (DPA) which is also summarized in Appendix C of RFC 1759 (Printer MIB). Examples of valid strings are "iso-a4-colored" and "na-10x14-envelope".

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A BinarySensor provides a boolean output. Given the addition of the CurrentState and PossibleStates properties to Sensor, the BinarySensor subclass is no longer necessary, but is retained for backward compatibility. A BinarySensor can be created by instantiating a Sensor with two PossibleStates.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The current value indicated by the Sensor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ExpectedReading indicates the 'normal' value for the Sensor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: InterpretationOfFalse is a string indicating what a 'False' value from the BinarySensor means. This information could be displayed to a user.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: InterpretationOfTrue is a string indicating what a 'True' value from the BinarySensor means. This information could be displayed to a user.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A Multi-StateSensor is a multi-member set of Sensors.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A DiscreteSensor has a set of legal string values, that it can report. These values are enumerated in the Sensor's PossibleValues property. A DiscreteSensor will always have a 'current reading' that corresponds to one of the enumerated values. Given the addition of the CurrentState and PossibleStates properties to Sensor, the DiscreteSensor subclass is no longer necessary, but is retained for backward compatibility. Information in the CurrentReading and PossibleValues properties will typically have the same values and semantics as for the CurrentState and PossibleStates properties, inherited from Sensor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: AcceptableValues details which of the PossibleValues strings are considered 'acceptable' (ie, 'not an error').

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The current value indicated by the Sensor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PossibleValues enumerates the string outputs that can be reported by the DiscreteSensor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This class exists for backward compatibility to earlier CIM Schema definitions. With additions to Sensor and NumericSensor in V2.2, it is no longer necessary. A TempertatureSensor can be defined by setting the SensorType property, inherited from Sensor, to 2 ("Temperature"). Other properties of this class are hard-coded to constant values to correspond to definitions in the Sensor hierarchy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This class exists for backward compatibility to earlier CIM Schema definitions. With additions to Sensor and NumericSensor in V2.2, it is no longer necessary. A CurrentSensor can be defined by setting the SensorType property, inherited from Sensor, to 4 ("Current"). Other properties of this class are hard-coded to constant values to correspond to definitions in the Sensor hierarchy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This class exists for backward compatibility to earlier CIM Schema definitions. With additions to Sensor and NumericSensor in V2.2, it is no longer necessary. A VoltageSensor can be defined by setting the SensorType property, inherited from Sensor, to 3 ("Voltage"). Other properties of this class are hard-coded to constant values to correspond to definitions in the Sensor hierarchy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This class exists for backward compatibility to earlier CIM Schema definitions. With additions to Sensor and NumericSensor in V2.2, it is no longer necessary. A Tachometer can be defined by setting the SensorType property. inherited from Sensor, to 5 ("Tachometer"). Other properties of this class are hard-coded to constant values to correspond to definitions in the Sensor hierarchy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: CIM_Watchdog is a timer implemented in system hardware. It allows the hardware to monitor the state of the OperatingSystem, BIOS or a software component installed on the System. If the monitored component fails to re-arm the timer before its expiration, the hardware assumes that the System is in a critical state, and could reset the ComputerSystem. This feature can also be used as an application watchdog timer for a mission-critical application. In this case, the application would assume responsibility for re-arming the timer before expiration.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The action that should happen upon the expiry of the watchdog.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The entity that is currently being monitored by the WatchDog. This property is used to identify the module that is responsible for re-arming the watchdog at periodic intervals.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A string describing more textual information about the monitored entity

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Monitored entity at the time of last timer expiry.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The time of the last timer expiry.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The timeout interval used by the watchdog, in MicroSeconds.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Resolution of the timer. For example, if this value is 100, then the timer can expire anytime between (TimeoutInterval-100) microseconds or (TimeoutInterval+100) microseconds.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A method to re-arm the timer. This method is only used if the MonitoredEntity is "Application". It returns 0 if successful, 1 if unsupported, and any other value if an error occurred. In a subclass, the set of possible return codes could be specified, using a ValueMap qualifier on the method. The strings to which the ValueMap contents are 'translated' may also be specified in the subclass as a Values array qualifier.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of a Refrigeration CoolingDevice.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of a HeatPipe CoolingDevice.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of a Fan CoolingDevice.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: DesiredSpeed is the currently requested fan speed, defined in Revolutions per Minute, when a variable speed fan is supported (VariableSpeed boolean = TRUE). The current speed is determined via a sensor (CIM_Tachometer) that is associated with the Fan using the CIM_AssociatedSensor relationship.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indication of whether the fan supports variable speeds.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Requests that the Fan speed be set to the value specified in the method's input parameter. The return value should be 0 if the request was successfully executed, 1 if the request is not supported and some other value if an error occurred. In a subclass, the set of possible return codes could be specified, using a ValueMap qualifier on the method. The strings to which the ValueMap contents are 'translated' may also be specified in the subclass as a Values array qualifier.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PointingDevice represents those Devices used to 'point' to regions of a Display.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Integer indicating whether the PointingDevice is configured for right (value=2) or left handed operation (value=3). Also, the values, "Unknown" (0) and "Not Applicable" (1), can be defined.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of buttons. If the PointingDevice has no buttons, enter 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The type of the pointing device.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Tracking resolution of the PointingDevice in Counts per Inch.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of the Keyboard LogicalDevice.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A free-form string indicating the format and layout of the Keyboard.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of function keys on the Keyboard.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An integer indicating whether a hardware-level password is enabled at the keyboard (value=4), preventing local input. Other values are: "Disabled" (3), "Not Implemented" (5), "Other" (1) and "Unknown" (2).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of the DesktopMonitor (CRT) LogicalDevice.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Monitor's bandwidth in MHertz. If unknown, enter 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The type of DesktopMonitor or CRT. For example, multiscan color or monochrome monitors (values 2 or 3, respectively) can be indicated in this property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The logical height of the Display in screen coordinates.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The logical width of the Display in screen coordinates.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: MonitorResolution describes the relationship between horizontal and vertical resolutions, refresh rate and scan mode for a DesktopMonitor. The actual resolutions, etc. that are in use, are the values specified in the VideoController object.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Monitor's maximum refresh rate in Hertz, when a range of rates is supported at the specified resolutions.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Monitor's minimum refresh rate in Hertz, when a range of rates is supported at the specified resolutions.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Monitor's refresh rate in Hertz. If a range of rates is supported, use the MinRefreshRate and MaxRefreshRate properties, and set RefreshRate (this property) to 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Integer indicating whether the monitor operates in interlaced (value=5) or non-interlaced (4) mode.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The inherited SettingID serves as part of the key for a MonitorResolution instance.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of the FlatPanel LogicalDevice.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An integer enumeration describing the type of flat panel display.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A description of the display illumination type. For example, backlit (value=2) or reflective (4) can be specified.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A FlatPanel's scan mode indicating either single (value=2) or dual scan (3).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Boolean indicating whether the FlatPanel supports color display.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of the Scanner LogicalDevice.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This Service is implemented by a LogicalDevice (e.g. a NetworkAdapter or Modem) that is capable of sending alert messages to a remote destination. The alert messages reflect the state of one or more ManagedSystemElements. The Elements for which alert messages are forwarded, are defined by enumerating the ProvidesServiceToElement association for the Service. Out of Band (OOB) refers to the mechanisms in use when normal OS-based management mechanisms are not possible. This occurs when the OS is down or not functioning properly.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The address where this Service sends the alerts. The format of this address depends on the DestinationType. For example, if the DestinationType is a UDP Port (value=4), then this property contains a string identifying the IP address of the Port (for example, 111.222.333.444:4567). If DestinationType is a pager (value=2), then the address is a Pager number (for example, 18002257654).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: If the destination is capable of sending an acknowledgement to the alert, then this flag is set to TRUE. The format of the acknowledgement is determined by the DestinationType and the MessageFormat.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The type of the alert destination. For example, the alert may be received by an application listening on a UDP Port on a remote destination, or could be sent to a pager (values 4 or 2, respectively).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AlertService may require some fixed data to send as part of the message. This may include things like the address or name of the System. This string contains the complete message when the property, OnlySendsFixedMessage, is set to TRUE.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The format of the Alert Message sent by the Service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: If the AlertService only uses a fixed message to send an alert, then this flag should be set to TRUE.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The description of the alert DestinationType. This is used when the DestinationType is set to "Other" (value=1).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The description of the format of the alert message used by the Service when the AlertMessageFormat property is set to "Other" (value=1).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AlertService may retry and send an alert more than once. The RetryCount identifies how often the operation will be repeated. If DestinationIsAckCapable is set to TRUE, then the retry will only be done if an Ack is not received. Otherwise, the retries are done unconditionally.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The interval between each successive retry, in seconds. If DestinationIsAckCapable is set to TRUE, then this interval is used as a timeout interval, before the next retry is done.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: WakeUpService allows a UnitaryComputerSystem to be woken up from a low power sleep state. This Service is implemented by a LogicalDevice (e.g. NetworkAdapter or Modem) that is capable of receiving wakeup messages, and notifying the System.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The binary data that is used to compare the contents of the received packet. This is used when the FilterType is set to "Binary Match" (value=7). This could also be used when the FilterType is set to "Other" (value=1).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The filter type on the packets/messages that trigger the WakeUpService. This field is only used when the WakeUpType is set to "Wake On LAN - Packet Filtering" (value=3).

VALUE.ARRAY.VALUE: IP Packet with Directed MAC Address

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The description of the format of the FilterType used by the Service when the FilterType is set to "Other" (value=1).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A description of the type of WakeUpService used when WakeUpType is set to "Other" (value=1).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Type of the WakeUp Service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The VDSLmodem class represents Modems of the DSL type = VDSL, Very high data rate Digital Subscriber Line. Properties will be defined in a future release of the model.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The HDSLModem class represents Modems of the DSL type = HDSL, High data rate Digital Subscribe Line, capable of delivering T1 or E1 speeds. Properties will be defined in a future release of the model.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The SDSLModem class represents Modems of the DSL type = SDSL, Symmetric Digital Subscriber Line. Properties will be defined in a future release of the model.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ADSLModem class represents Modems of the DSL type = ADSL, Asymmetric Digital Subscriber Line.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Measured difference in the total power transmitted by the peer Modem and the total power received by this Modem. This is measured in tenths of dB.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Status indicates the current state of the connection (line). The property holds a bitmap describing the possible conditions. For example, 1) No Defect - There no defects on the line; 2) Loss Of Framing - ATUR failure due to not receiving valid frame; 4) Loss Of Signal - ATUR failure due to not receiving signal; 8) Loss Of Power - ATUR failure due to loss of power; 32) Loss Of Signal Quality - Loss of Signal Quality is declared when the NoiseMargin falls below the minimum NoiseMargin, or the bit-error-rate exceeds 10^-7.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indicates the maximum currently attainable data rate for the Modem. This value will be equal or greater than the current line rate.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Noise Margin of this Modem with respect to its received signal, in tenths of dB.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Measured total output power (in tenths of dB) transmitted by this Modem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The CableModem class represents a device for transmission across a cable infrastructure.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ISDNModem class, a kind of call-based Modem. Properties will be defined in a future release of the model.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Unimodem is a POTSModem that supports the Unimodem 1.0 Specification.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of Call waiting events detected for the last or current call.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Carrier Rate re-negotiation event count for the last or current call.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of carrier retrains granted during the current or last call.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of carrier retrains requested during the current or last call.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Current DTE-DCE interface mode of the Unimodem, such as asynchronous, v.80 transparent or framed synchronous modes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Error Control frame size in bytes for the last or current call.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Error control link NAKs received for the last or current call.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Error control link timeouts in transmission for the last or current call.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Estimated noise level for the last or current call in -dBm. Values are in the range of 0-100.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Final receive carrier data rate of the current or last call, in bits per second.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Final transmit carrier data rate of the current or last call, in bits per second.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Initial receive carrier data rate for the current or last call, in bits per second.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Initial transmit carrier data rate for the current or last call, in bits per second.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Current multi-media mode of the Unimodem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Normalized mean squared error for the last or current call.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of receive characters lost for the last or current call. A DCE may limit this counter to 16 bits, but additional bits may be provided and are accounted for in this property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of receive chars sent to the DTE for the last or current call. A continuous connection may exceed this value, given enough time. Typically these counters are implemented as 32 bit counters, but additional bits may be provided and are accounted for in this property. If these counters hit maximum value, the DCE manufacturer may roll over to 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of I-Frame errors detected for the last or current call, if error control protocol is running. A DCE may limit this counter to 16 bits, but additional bits may be provided and are accounted for in this property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The flow control mechanism used in receiving data.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of I-Frames received for the last or current call. A continuous connection may exceed this value, given enough time. Typically these counters are implemented as 32 bit counters, but additional bits may be provided and are accounted for in this property. If these counters hit maximum value, the DCE manufacturer may roll over to 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Temporary carrier loss event count for the last or current call.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of transmit characters lost for the last or current call. A DCE may limit this counter to 16 bits, but additional bits may be provided and are accounted for in this property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of transmit chars sent from the DTE for the last or current call. A continuous connection may exceed this value, given enough time. Typically these counters are implemented as 32 bit counters, but additional bits may be provided and are accounted for in this property. If these counters hit maximum value, the DCE manufacturer may roll over to 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The flow control mechanism used in transmitting data.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of I-Frames transmitted for the last or current call. A continuous connection may exceed this value, given enough time. Typically these counters are implemented as 32 bit counters, but additional bits may be provided and are accounted for in this property. If these counters hit maximum value, the DCE manufacturer may roll over to 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of I-Frame errors detected for the last or current call, if error control protocol is running. A DCE may limit this counter to 16 bits, but additional bits may be provided and are accounted for in this property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Diagnostic Command Specification, Unimodem revision number.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of the Battery LogicalDevice. This class applies to both batteries in Laptop Systems and other internal/external batteries, such as used in, or as UPSs.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Description of the Battery's charge status. Values such as "Fully Charged" (value=3) or "Partially Charged" (11) can be specified. The value, 10, is not valid in the CIM Schema since in DMI it represents that no battery is installed. In this case, this object should not be instantiated.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumeration that describes the Battery's chemistry.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The design capacity of the battery in mWatt-hours. If this property is not supported, enter 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The design voltage of the battery in mVolts. If this attribute is not supported, enter 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An estimate of the percentage of full charge remaining.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: EstimatedRunTime is an estimate in minutes of the time to battery charge depletion under the present load conditions if the utility power is off, or lost and remains off, or a Laptop is disconnected from a power source.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indicates the Battery's expected lifetime in minutes, assuming that the Battery is fully charged. This property represents the total expected life of the Battery, not its current remaining life, which is indicated by the EstimatedRunTime property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The full charge capacity of the battery in mWatt-hours. Comparison of this value to the Battery DesignCapacity determines when the Battery requires replacement. A Battery's end of life is typically when the FullChargeCapacity falls below 80% of the DesignCapacity. If this property is not supported, enter 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: MaxRechargeTime indicates the maximum time, in minutes, to fully charge the Battery. This property represents the time to recharge a fully depleted Battery, not the current remaining charging time, which is indicated in the TimeToFullCharge property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Smart Battery Data Specification version number supported by this Battery. If the Battery does not support this function, the value should be left blank.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: TimeOnBattery indicates the elapsed time in seconds since the ComputerSystem, UPS, ... last switched to battery power, or the time since the System or UPS was last restarted, whichever is less. Zero shall be returned if the Battery is 'on line'.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The remaining time to charge the battery fully in minutes at the current charging rate and usage.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of an UninterruptiblePowerSupply. The properties of the UPS Device indicate when incoming power is trimmed or boosted, and the aggregated information of the batteries, generators, etc. that comprise the Device. These individual components (for example, multiple batteries) can also be independently modeled and associated with the UPS.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An estimate of the percentage of full charge remaining for a UPS (that uses battery technology).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: EstimatedRunTime is an estimate in minutes of the time to battery, generator, ... depletion under the present load conditions if the utility power is off, or lost and remains off.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: If the voltage (in millivolts) rises above the value specified by Range1InputVoltageHigh, the UPS will compensate by trimming the voltage. A value of 0 indicates that the voltage at which trimming occurs is 'unknown'.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: If the voltage (in millivolts) drops below the value specified by Range1InputVoltageLow, the UPS will compensate by boosting the voltage using its power source(s). A value of 0 indicates that the voltage at which boosting occurs is 'unknown'.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: If the voltage (in millivolts) rises above the value specified by Range2InputVoltageHigh, the UPS will compensate by trimming the voltage. A value of 0 indicates that the voltage at which trimming occurs is 'unknown'.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: If the voltage (in millivolts) drops below the value specified by Range2InputVoltageLow, the UPS will compensate by boosting the voltage using its power source(s). A value of 0 indicates that the voltage at which boosting occurs is 'unknown'.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The indication of the capacity remaining in the UPS' batteries, generator, ... A value of "Normal" (2) indicates that the remaining estimated minutes of run-time is greater than the UPS' defined 'low power' state (typically two minutes). A value of "Low" (3) indicates that the remaining estimated minutes of run-time is less than or equal to the UPS' defined 'low power' state. A value of "Depleted" (4) indicates that the UPS will be unable to sustain the present load when and if the utility power is lost (including the possibility that the utility power is currently absent).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: TimeOnBackup indicates the elapsed time in seconds since the UPS last switched to battery power, generator, ... Or, the time since the UPS was last restarted, whichever is less. Zero shall be returned if the UPS is 'on line'.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of an EthernetAdapter.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A count of frames received on a particular interface that are not an integral number of octets in length and do not pass the FCS check. The count represented by an instance of this object is incremented when the alignmentError status is returned by the MAC layer to the LLC (or other MAC user). Received frames for which multiple error conditions obtain are, according to the conventions of IEEE 802.3 Layer Management, counted exclusively according to the error status presented to the LLC.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities of the EthernetAdapter. For example, the Device may support AlertOnLan, WakeOnLan, Load Balancing and/or FailOver. If failover or load balancing capabilities are listed, a SpareGroup (failover) or ExtraCapacityGroup (load balancing) should also be defined to completely describe the capability.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any of the EthernetAdapter features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times that the carrier sense condition was lost or never asserted when attempting to transmit a frame on a particular interface. The count represented by an instance of this object is incremented at most once per transmission attempt, even if the carrier sense condition fluctuates during a transmission attempt.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A count of frames for which the first transmission attempt on a particular interface is delayed because the medium is busy. The count represented by an instance of this object does not include frames involved in collisions.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies which capabilities are enabled from the list of all supported ones, defined in the Capabilities array.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A count of frames for which transmission on a particular interface fails due to excessive collisions.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A count of frames received on a particular interface that are an integral number of octets in length but do not pass the FCS check. The count represented by an instance of this object is incremented when the frameCheckError status is returned by the MAC layer to the LLC (or other MAC user). Received frames for which multiple error conditions obtain are, according to the conventions of IEEE 802.3 Layer Management, counted exclusively according to the error status presented to the LLC.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A count of frames received on a particular interface that exceed the maximum permitted frame size. The count represented by an instance of this object is incremented when the FrameTooLong status is returned by the MAC layer to the LLC (or other MAC user). Received frames for which multiple error conditions obtain are, according to the conventions of IEEE 802.3 Layer Management, counted exclusively according to the error status presented to the LLC.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A count of frames for which reception on a particular interface fails due to an internal MAC sublayer receive error. A frame is only counted by an instance of this object if it is not counted by the corresponding instance of either the FrameTooLongs property, the AlignmentErrors property, or the FCSErrors property. The precise meaning of the count represented by an instance of this object is implementation-specific. In particular, an instance of this object may represent a count of receive errors on a particular interface that are not otherwise counted.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A count of frames for which transmission on a particular interface fails due to an internal MAC sublayer transmit error. A frame is only counted by an instance of this object if it is not counted by the corresponding instance of either the LateCollisions property, the ExcessiveCollisions property, or the CarrierSenseErrors property. The precise meaning of the count represented by an instance of this object is implementation-specific. In particular, an instance of this object may represent a count of transmission errors on a particular interface that are not otherwise counted.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times that a collision is detected on a particular interface later than 512 bit-times into the transmission of a packet. Five hundred and twelve bit-times corresponds to 51.2 microseconds on a 10 Mbit/s system. A (late) collision included in a count represented by an instance of this object is also considered as a (generic) collision for purposes of other collision-related statistics.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The maximum size of the INFO (non-MAC) field that will be received or transmitted.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A count of successfully transmitted frames on a particular interface for which transmission is inhibited by more than one collision. A frame that is counted by an instance of this object is not counted by the corresponding instance of the SingleCollisionFrames property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Ethernet/802.3 MAC addresses formatted as twelve hexadecimal digits (e.g. "010203040506"), with each pair representing one of the six octets of the MAC address in "canonical" bit order. (Thus, the Group address bit is found in the low order bit of the first character of the string.)

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A count of successfully transmitted frames on a particular interface for which transmission is inhibited by exactly one collision. A frame that is counted by an instance of this object is not counted by the corresponding instance of the MultipleCollisionFrames property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A count of times that the SQE TEST ERROR message is generated by the PLS sublayer for a particular interface. The SQE TEST ERROR message is defined in section 7.2.2.2.4 of ANSI/IEEE 802.3-1985 and its generation is described in section 7.2.4.6 of the same document.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times there was an invalid data symbol when a valid carrier was present. The count is incremented at most once per carrier event, even if multiple symbol errors occur during the carrier event.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The total number of packets received.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The total number of packets transmitted.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of a TokenRingAdapter.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This counter is incremented when a station transmits an abort delimiter while transmitting data.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This counter is incremented when a station receives an AMP or SMP frame in which A is equal to C is equal to 0, and then receives another SMP frame with A equal to C equal to 0 without first receiving an AMP frame. It denotes a station that cannot set the AC bits properly.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This counter is incremented when a station detects the absence of transitions for five half-bit timers (burst-five errors).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities of the TokenRingAdapter. For example, the Device may support AlertOnLan, WakeOnLan, Load Balancing and/or Failover. If failover or load balancing capabilities are listed, a SpareGroup (failover) or ExtraCapacityGroup (load balancing) should also be defined to completely describe the capability.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any of the TokenRingAdapter features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Specifies which of the capabilities from the "Capabilities" property are currently enabled.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This counter is incremented when a station recognizes a frame addressed to its specific address and detects that the FS field A bits are set to 1 indicating a possible line hit or duplicate address.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times the Device has detected that the frequency of the incoming signal differs from the expected frequency by more than that specified by the IEEE 802.5 standard.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times this Device has detected an immediately recoverable fatal error. It denotes the number of times this Device is either transmitting or receiving beacon MAC frames.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This counter is incremented when a station recognizes an internal error.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times the Device has detected an open or short circuit in the lobe data path. The adapter will be closed and RingState will signify this condition.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This counter is incremented when a station is transmitting and its TRR timer expires. This denotes a condition where a transmitting station in strip mode does not receive the trailer of the frame before the TRR timer goes off.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The maximum size of the INFO (non-MAC) field that will be received or transmitted.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Token Ring/802.5 MAC addresses formatted as twelve hexadecimal digits (e.g. "010203040506"), with each pair representing one of the six octets of the MAC address in "canonical" bit order. (Thus, the Group address bit is found in the low order bit of the first character of the string.)

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This counter is incremented when a station recognizes a frame addressed to its specific address, but has no available buffer space - indicating that the station is congested.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of Claim Token MAC frames received or transmitted after the Device has received a Ring Purge MAC frame. This counter signifies the number of times the ring has been purged and is being recovered back into a normal operating state.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times the Device has received a Remove Ring Station MAC frame request. When this frame is received, the Device will enter the close state and RingState will signify this condition.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This property indicates the success, or the reason for failure, of the station's most recent attempt to enter the ring.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The current Device state with respect to entering or leaving the ring.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The current status which can be used to diagnose fluctuating problems that can occur on token rings, after a station has successfully been added to the ring. Before an open is completed, this object contains the value indicating "no status" (131072). (The RingState and RingOpenStatus properties are also provided for debugging problems when the station can not even enter the ring.) The property's value is a sum of values, one for each currently applicable condition. The following values are defined for various conditions: 0 = No Problems Detected, 32 = Ring Recovery, 64 = Single Station, 256 = Remove Received, 512 = Reserved, 1024 = Auto-Removal Error, 2048 = Lobe Wire Fault, 4096 = Transmit Beacon, 8192 = Soft Error, 16384 = Hard Error, 32768 = Signal Loss, 131072 = No Status, Open Not Completed.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times this Device has detected the loss of signal condition from the ring.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times the Device has sensed that it is the only station on the ring. This will happen if the Device is the first one up on a ring, or if there is a hardware problem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of Soft Errors that the Device has detected. It directly corresponds to the number of Report Error MAC frames that this Device has transmitted. Soft Errors are those which are recoverable by the MAC layer protocols.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This counter is incremented when a station acting as the active monitor recognizes an error condition that needs a token transmitted.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times this Device has transmitted a beacon frame.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of a Fibre Channel Adapter.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of times that the Device has been without a buffer credit for a time longer than ErrorDetectTimeout.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A list of the Capabilities of the Fibre Channel Adapter. For example, that the Adapter utilizes the Directory Server, or that it generates State Change Notifications can be indicated using the values 2 and 12, respectively.

VALUE.ARRAY.VALUE: Utilizes the Security Key Distribution Server

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any of the Adapter features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of Class 1 sequences sent since last reset of the Device.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of frames discarded by the Adapter when running Class 2 service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of frames received by the Adapter when running Class 2 service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of frames transmitted by the Adapter when running Class 2 service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of octets received by the Adapter when running Class 2 service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of octets transmitted by the Adapter when running Class 2 service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of Class 2 sequences sent since last reset of the Device.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of frames discarded by the Adapter when running Class 3 service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of frames received by the Adapter when running Class 3 service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of frames transmitted by the Adapter when running Class 3 service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of octets received by the Adapter when running Class 3 service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of octets transmitted by the Adapter when running Class 3 service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of Class 3 sequences sent since last reset of the Device.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of Class 4 sequences sent since last reset of the Device.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of integers indicating the Fibre Channel FC-4 protocols currently running on the Adapter. A list of all protocols supported by the Adapter is indicated in the FC4TypesSupported property. The values used in this array are taken from the FC-GS2 (bitmapped) field defined in Table 11 of the standard. Also, FC-SB-2 codes are included from the T11 document, 236V0. If the FC4 Type is "Vendor Unique" (value=255), then the specific vendor values (in the range, 0xE0 to 0xFF) that are currently running should be listed in the CurrentFC4VendorTypes property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: When the CurrentFC4Types array contains the value 255 ("Vendor Unique"), then the property, CurrentFC4VendorTypes, lists all the vendor specific protocols running on the Adapter. These values are in the range, 0xE0 to 0xFF.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of times that the Device has been without an end credit for a time longer than ErrorDetectTimeout.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A 'short' timeout value (in milliseconds) for determining that an error has occurred. The default value is 10 seconds (10000 milliseconds).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of integers indicating the Fibre Channel FC-4 protocols supported by the Adapter. The protocols that are active and running are indicated in the CurrentFC4Types property. The values used in this array are taken from the FC-GS2 (bitmapped) field defined in Table 11 of the standard. Also, FC-SB-2 codes are included from the T11 document, 236V0. If the FC4 Type is "Vendor Unique" (value=255), then the specific vendor values (in the range, 0xE0 to 0xFF) should be listed in the FC4VendorUniqueTypes property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: When the FC4TypesSupported array contains the value 255 ("Vendor Unique"), then the property, FC4VendorUniqueTypes, lists of all the vendor specific protocols supported by the Adapter. These values are in the range, 0xE0 to 0xFF.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of Class 1 or 2 frames that are not ACKed within the time indicated by ErrorDetectTimeout.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The maximum frame size, in bytes, supported by the Adapter.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of frames received out of order.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of parity errors detected somewhere in the data path.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times that a frame was received but no buffer was available.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times that a frame was received but no end-to-end credit was available.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A 'long' timeout value (in milliseconds) for determining when to reinstate a Recovery_Qualifier. The default value is 120 seconds (120000 milliseconds). It is typically set to the ErrorDetectTimeout value + 2*(fabric delay time).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Fibre Channel Classes of Service that are supported by the Adapter, on its Ports. The currently negotiated COS for a connection is a property (NegotiatedCOS) on the FibrePortActiveLogin association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Error and event counters specific to a Fibre Channel Adapter.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of Abort sequence frames received.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of Abort sequence frames sent where the response was BA_RJT.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of Abort sequence frames sent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of frames busied by the Fabric.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of frames rejected by the Fabric.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of frames busied by the receiving Node.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of frames busied by the Adapter itself.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of frames rejected by the receiving Node.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of frames rejected by the Adapter itself.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of PRLI frames sent where the response was LS_RJT.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of PRLO frames sent where the response was LS_RJT.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Method to reset the Adapter event counters. The method takes one parameter as input - an integer indicating which counter to reset. For this input parameter, 0 indicates all, 1 through 11 indicate a reset of the individual counters. The method returns 0 if successful, 1 if not supported, and any other value if an error occurred. A method is specified so that the Device's instrumentation, which tabulates the errors and warnings, can also reset its internal processing and counters. In a subclass, the set of possible return codes could be specified, using a ValueMap qualifier on the method. The strings to which the ValueMap contents are 'translated' may also be specified in the subclass as a Values array qualifier.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of a Fibre Channel Port Device.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An address value used to identify the source (S_ID) or destination (D_ID) of a frame. The FC-SW standard includes a table of special address identifier values and their meanings. Consult the FC-SW documentation for additional information.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: One or more address identifiers that may be recognized by the Port, in addition to its port-specific identifier. Multicast or hunt group addresses that are recognized by the Port would be identified in this array.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indication of whether the Port is currently bypassed (value=2) or not (value=1). A value of 3 ("Forced Insert") describes that the Port is forced active, when it would otherwise be "Bypassed".

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The type of cabling as sensed by the Port. Not all FibrePorts are capable of providing this information. In this case, a value of 0, "Unknown", will be returned. Also, when single or multi-mode fiber cabling can not be distinguished, the more general value - 4, "Fiber-optic" - can be specified.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of times that the CRC in a frame does not match the CRC computed by the receiver.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The specific mode in which the Port is currently running. The value is one of the entries in the EnabledPortTypes array. The current port type/mode is dependent on the fibre technology. For example, in a public loop network, you might indicate a port type of "FL" (value=6) or "NL" (value=2).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Version information for the CurrentPortType that is active.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times that a fill word could not be deleted, when required. The Elasticity Buffer is defined in FC-AL. This event might cause data corruption and may indicate a configuration error or a device out of spec.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of times that a fill word could not be inserted, when required. The Elasticity Buffer is defined in FC-AL. This event might cause data corruption and may indicate a configuration error or a device out of spec.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The specific modes currently enabled for the Port. The values are equal to, or a subset of the values in the SupportedPortTypes array.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Version information for each of the EnabledPortTypes. A particular PortType (mode) may be listed multiple times in the EnabledPortTypes array in order to define multiple, unique version levels. Note that each entry of this array is related to the entry in EnabledPortTypes that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of frames received that were longer than 2140 octets. The value of 2140 is calculated based on an assumption of 24 header bytes plus 4 CRC bytes and 2112 bytes of payload.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of frames received that were shorter than 28 octets. The value of 28 is calculated based on an assumption of 24 header bytes plus 4 CRC bytes. The count does not include SOF/EOF bytes which are not data.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of transmission words that had an 8b10b code violation in one or more of its characters, had a K28.5 in its second, third or fourth character positions, and/or was an ordered set that had an incorrect Beginning Running Disparity.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of times that signal is lost on the Port since last reset of the Device.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of times that synchronization is lost on the Port since last reset of the Device. Synchronization is assumed lost after a timeout period identified by the ReceiverTransmitterTimeout property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Version information for each of the SupportedPortTypes. A particular PortType (mode) may be listed multiple times in the SupportedPortTypes array in order to define multiple, unique version levels. Note that each entry of this array is related to the entry in SupportedPortTypes that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Timeout value in milliseconds used to determine when loss of synchronization has occurred. The typical default is 100 msec.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE:
An array indicating the modes in which the Port can operate. PortType values describe the role and behavior of the Fibre Channel entity: "N" = Node Port, "NL" = Node Port supporting FC arbitrated loop, "E" = Expansion Port connecting fabric elements (for example, FC switches), "F" = Fabric (element) Port, "FL" = Fabric (element) Port supporting FC arbitrated loop, and "B" = Bridge Port. PortTypes are defined in the ANSI X3 standards.
A particular mode may be listed multiple times in the SupportedPortTypes array in order to define that multiple, unique version levels are supported. Version information is defined in the PortTypeVersions property. Note that each entry of the SupportedPortTypes array is related to the entry in PortTypeVersions that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Error and event counters specific to a Fibre Channel Port (connection point).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of frames received containing 'EOF Abort'.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of frames transmitted containing 'EOF Abort'.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of login frames received.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of PLOGI frames sent where the response was LS_RJT.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of login frames sent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of logouts received from various targets.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of PLOGO frames sent where the response was LS_RJT.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The number of logout frames sent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Method to reset the Port event counters. The method takes one parameter as input - an integer indicating which counter to reset. For this input parameter, 0 indicates all, 1 through 8 indicate a reset of the individual counters. The method returns 0 if successful, 1 if not supported, and any other value if an error occurred. A method is specified so that the Device's instrumentation, which tabulates the errors and warnings, can also reset its internal processing and counters. In a subclass, the set of possible return codes could be specified, using a ValueMap qualifier on the method. The strings to which the ValueMap contents are 'translated' may also be specified in the subclass as a Values array qualifier.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: FibreProtocolService abstracts and allows the management of the Alias, Management, Time, Security, Directory (Naming) and other services and functions available in a Fibre Channel network. This class will be further defined in a later release of CIM.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of an SSAController (Serial Storage Architecture).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of the ParallelController.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An integer enumeration indicating the capabilities of the ParallelController.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An array of free-form strings providing more detailed explanations for any of the ParallelController features indicated in the Capabilities array. Note, each entry of this array is related to the entry in the Capabilities array that is located at the same index.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Set to true if the ParallelController supports DMA.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumeration indicating the operational security for the Controller. For example, information that the Device's external interface is locked out (value=4) or "Boot Bypass" (value=6) can be described using this property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Capabilities and management of the SerialController.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Capabilities property defines chip level compatibility for the SerialController. Therefore, this property describes the buffering and other capabilities of the SerialController, that may be inherent in the chip hardware. The property is an enumerated integer.
