QUALIFIER.VALUE: Boolean indicating whether the software is upgradeable, when it is LoadedOnDevice. Software that is loaded as part of the OperatingSystem is typically changeable and upgradeable. However, when DeviceSoftware is burned into EEPROM or a chip that Realizes the LogicalDevice, then it may not be upgradeable. This property indicates the ability to update and upgrade DeviceSoftware.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ActsAsSpare association indicates which elements can spare or replace the other aggregated elements. The fact that a spare can operate in "hot standby" mode is specified on an element by element basis.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: HotStandby is a boolean indicating that the spare is operating as a hot standby.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A ManagedSystemElement acting as a spare and participating in the SpareGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association indicates that a Printer can be passed PrintJobs from a particular Queue.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A destination Printer for Jobs enqueued on the Dependent Queue.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A Queue that is providing Jobs to the Printer.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association indicates that a Printer is currently servicing a particular PrintJob.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The destination Printer for a PrintJob.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association indicates which files are associated with a PrintJob.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PrintJob that is based on one or more Files.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The File(s) that make up a PrintJob.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association indicates that a PrintService utilizes a particular PrintQueue.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PrintQueue that the Service utilizes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PrintService that puts Jobs on the Queue.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indicates that the PrintService can accept Jobs and place them on the Queue.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association indicates that the Jobs from a PrintQueue can be sent to the referenced PrintSAP, to be handled by the SAP's backing PrintService.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PrintQueue that forwards Jobs to the SAP.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association indicates which Queue holds a PrintJob and where the Job is located within that Queue. A Job may remain on its final Queue once it has been printed with a PrintJobStatus of "Complete" or "Completed With Error".

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PrintQueue on which the Job is held.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The position of the PrintJob on the Queue. The top of the Queue is indicated by a value of 1 with higher values being used to represent Jobs that are further away from the top of the Queue. A QueuePosition of zero indicate that the Job has completed (either with or without error).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The CollectionOfSensors association indicates the Sensors that make up a MultiStateSensor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A Sensor that is part of the MultiStateSensor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Many Devices, such as processors or power supplies, require their own cooling devices. This association indicates where fans or other CoolingDevices are specific to a Device, versus providing enclosure or cabinet cooling.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: MonitorSetting associates the MonitorResolution Setting object with the DesktopMonitor to which it applies.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The MonitorResolution associated with the DesktopMonitor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: OOBAlertServiceOnModem defines where the out of band alerting Service is implemented. The Service can either employ a Modem or NetworkAdapter to send alerts.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Modem which implements the alerting Service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The alerting Service provided on the Modem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: WakeUpServiceOnModem defines where the WakeUpService is implemented. The Service can either employ a Modem or NetworkAdapter to receive a wakeup signal.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Modem which implements the WakeUpService.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The wakeup Service provided on the Modem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The SuppliesPower relationship indicates that a Device is in the power domain of the referenced PowerSupply or UPS. It indicates which Device(s) are dependent on the PowerSupply, and hence, which Devices are affected if the Supply is lost.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A LogicalDevice in the power domain of the Supply.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A PowerSupply may have an associated VoltageSensor, monitoring its input voltage. This is described by this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PowerSupply associated with the VoltageSensor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indicates the PowerSupply's input voltage range measured by the associated sensor. Range 1, 2 or both can be specified using the values 2, 3 or 4, respectively.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A PowerSupply may have an associated CurrentSensor, monitoring its input frequency. This is described by this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PowerSupply associated with the CurrentSensor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indicates the PowerSupply's input frequency range measured by the associated sensor. Range 1, 2 or both can be specified using the values 2, 3 or 4, respectively.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A LogicalDevice may use or require one or more Batteries. This relationship is described by the AssociatedBattery dependency. It is also possible to model the individual Batteries that comprise a UPS, using this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The LogicalDevice needing or associated with the Battery.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: OOBAlertServiceOnNetworkAdapter defines where the out of band alerting Service is implemented. Currently, the Service can either employ a Modem or a NetworkAdapter to send alerts.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The NetworkAdapter which implements the Service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The alerting Service provided on the NetworkAdapter.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: WakeUpServiceOnNetworkAdapter defines where the WakeUpService is implemented. Currently, the Service can either employ a Modem or a NetworkAdapter for wakeup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The NetworkAdapter which implements the Service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The wakeup Service provided on the NetworkAdapter.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: FibrePortOnFCAdapter associates a FibrePort with a FibreChannelAdapter. Cardinalities are defined as Max(1) to indicate the intent and usage of the model - that an Adapter is synonymous with its Port (connection point). Where you have a multi-Port Adapter and more than one Port may be active at a time, individual Adapters with individual operating data and characteristics really exist. If you have multiple connection points, but they exist only to provide multiple physical form factors (only one connection may be active at a time), then one FibreChannelAdapter and one FibrePort (the active one) exist. On the hardware side, the realizations of these entities in PhysicalElements may be as a CIM_Card (for example) with multiple CIM_PhysicalConnectors.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The FibreChannelAdapter that includes the Port.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: FibrePortActiveLogin indicates that two FibrePorts are connected via a login and have negotiated their Class Of Service, frame size and other link characteristics, as specified by an instance of this class. The class' key is composed of the login originator's and responder's keys plus the Class Of Service. This combination is unique and prevents subclassing FibrePortActiveLogin from its reasonable superclass, DeviceConnection.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Acknowledgement model negotiated during Port login. For example, ACK-1 indicates that each frame should be acknowledged.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The buffer-to-buffer model negotiated during Port login. Either the model defined by the FC-PH standard is used (value=1, "Regular"), or an "Alternate" model is negotiated.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Fibre Channel Class of Service that is currently running between the Ports. Since two Ports can be simultaneously connected at different Classes of Service, this property had to be part of the object's key and therefore, an instance's identity.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Fibre Channel frame size, in bytes, that is currently negotiated between the two Ports.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The speed for communications that is currently negotiated between the two Ports. Speed is specified in bits per second. If this information is not available, the property should be set to 0.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: OriginatorBufferCredit reflects the buffer credit of the Port defined as the LoginOriginator. It is the number of frame buffers made available BY the originating Port, TO the responder Port. Buffer credits are used in point to point connections, when an NL-Local Port is logged into another NL-Local Port, and when Nx Ports are logged into Fx Ports. In other scenarios, this value is undefined.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: OriginatorEndCredit reflects the end credit of the Port defined as the LoginOriginator. It is the number of frame buffers made available BY the originating Port, TO the responder Port. End credits are used in point to point connections, when an NL-Local Port is logged into another NL-Local Port, and when Nx Ports are logged into remote Nx Ports. In other scenarios, this value is undefined.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ResponderBufferCredit reflects the buffer credit of the Port defined as the LoginResponder. It is the number of frame buffers made available BY the responder Port, TO the originating Port. Buffer credits are used in point to point connections, when an NL-Local Port is logged into another NL-Local Port, and when Nx Ports are logged into Fx Ports. In other scenarios, this value is undefined.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ResponderEndCredit reflects the end credit of the Port defined as the LoginResponder. It is the number of frame buffers made available BY the responder Port, TO the originating Port. End credits are used in point to point connections, when an NL-Local Port is logged into another NL-Local Port, and when Nx Ports are logged into remote Nx Ports. In other scenarios, this value is undefined.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: CIM_NetworkAdapterRedundancyComponent indicates the role that a NetworkAdapter plays in a ExtraCapacityGroup, providing load balancing.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The RedundancyGroup representing a set of load balanced NetworkAdapters.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Network Adapter(s) belonging to the RedundancyGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Boolean indicating whether the Network Adapter is an original primary adapter (value=1), a preferred primary adapter (2), or both (3). Values of "Unknown" and "Not Applicable" may also be specified.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Indicates the scope of load balancing for the NetworkAdapters involved in the RedundancyGroup. Load balancing may be restricted to transmitting data only (value=1), receiving data only (value=2), or used for both transmit and receive (value=3).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: NetworkVirtualAdapter describes that an instance of NetworkAdapter is actually the result of several Adapters participating in a load balanced RedundancyGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ExtraCapacity RedundancyGroup that describes the load balancing. The result of the load balancing is the 'virtual' Adapter.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SerialInterface is a ControlledBy relationship indicating which Devices are accessed through the SerialController and the characteristics of this access.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An integer enumeration indicating the flow control (Xon-Xoff and/or RTS/CTS) for transmitted data.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: For the SerialInterface, NegotiatedDataWidth is the number of data bits to be transmitted, without stop bits or parity.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of stop bits to be transmitted.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Information on the parity setting for transmitted data. No parity (value=1), even (2) or odd (3) can be specified.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SCSIInterface is a ControlledBy relationship indicating which Devices are accessed through a SCSIController and the characteristics of this access.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Maximum number of Command Descriptor Blocks (CDBs) that can be supported by the target. This data can not be obtained under all circumstances.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The maximum number of concurrent Command Descriptor Blocks (CDBs) that the initiator will send to the target. This value should never be greater than MaxQueueDepth.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SCSIReservation indicates the type of SCSI reservation that currently exists between the source and destination.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of SCSI retries that have occurred since last hard or soft reset related to the controlled Device. The time of last reset is indicated in the TimeOfDeviceReset property, inherited from the ControlledBy association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The SCSI signal characteristics being used for this connection. The value listed here must also be listed in the SCSIController's SignalCapabilities field.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Number of SCSI timeouts that have occurred since last hard or soft reset related to the controlled Device. The time of last reset is indicated in the TimeOfDeviceReset property, inherited from the ControlledBy association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: VideoSetting associates the VideoControllerResolution Setting with the Controller(s) to which it applies.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The resolutions, refresh rates, scan mode and number of colors that can be set for the Controller.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: USBPortOnHub associates a USBPort or connection point with the USBHub that includes it.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Hub that includes the USBPort.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: USBControllerHasHub defines the Hub(s) that are downstream of the USBController.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The USBHub that is associated with the Controller.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: USBConnection associates a Device with the USBPort to which it is connected.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The USBDevice that is connected to the Port.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Association indicating the processor(s) of a UnitaryComputerSystem. At least one processor is required. Note that this relationship inherits from the SystemDevice association, and therefore, the System Processor is weak to the aggregating UnitaryComputerSystem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Processor which is part of the UnitaryComputerSystem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An association between a FileSystem and the StorageExtent where it is located. Typically, a FileSystem ResidesOn a LogicalDisk.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The FileSystem that is located on the StorageExtent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Where a StorageExtent must be accessed through a MediaAccessDevice, this relationship is described by the MediaPresent association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The StorageExtent accessed using the MediaAccessDevice.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Boolean indicating that the accessed StorageExtent is fixed in the MediaAccessDevice and can not be ejected.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The StorageDefect aggregation collects the StorageErrors for a StorageExtent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Error references the Error object, defining the starting and ending addresses that are 'mapped out' of the StorageExtent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Extent reference defines the StorageExtent on which the errors occurred.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Describes the PhysicalExtents participating in a StorageRedundancyGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalExtent participating in the RedundancyGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ProtectedSpaceExtents are BasedOn a PhysicalExtent. This relationship is made explicit in this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ProtectedSpaceExtent which is built on the PhysicalExtent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The starting logical block address of the PhysicalExtent from which this ProtectedSpaceExtent is derived.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: VolumeSets are BasedOn on one or more ProtectedSpaceExtents. This relationship is made explicit in this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The VolumeSet which is built on the ProtectedSpaceExtent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: True if the logical block mapping algorithm includes check data bytes. This property corresponds to the NOCHKSKIP attribute in the SCC-2 Volume Set PS_Extent Descriptor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: True if logical blocks in the ProtectedSpaceExtent are mapped in decrementing order. This property corresponds to the INCDEC value in the SCC-2 Volume Set PS_Extent Descriptor.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: DiskPartitions should be BasedOn a single StorageVolume (for example, exposed by a hardware RAID cabinet), an SCC VolumeSet, or realized directly in PhysicalMedia. The first two relationships are made explicit in this association. The latter is conveyed by the RealizesDiskPartition association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The DiskPartition which is built on the Volume.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: TapePartitionOnSurface represents the ability to have one or more TapePartitions on each surface of a PhysicalTape. The individual surfaces are represented as instances of CIM_StorageExtent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The StorageExtent that represents the Tape's surface.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The TapePartition which is built on the Extent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: LogicalDisks can be BasedOn a VolumeSet. This association is an optimization where software RAID doesn't exist and the LogicalDisk is built right on top of a VolumeSet presented by an SCC cabinet. However, this would be better modeled by a DiskPartition BasedOn the VolumeSet (described using the DiskPartitionBasedOnVolume association) and then basing the LogicalDisk on the DiskPartition (using the LogicalDiskBasedOnPartition association).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: LogicalDisks can be BasedOn a DiskPartition. For example, a personal computer's C: drive may be located on a Partition on local PhysicalMedia. In this association of LogicalDisks to Partitions, note that the cardinality of the Antecedent, DiskPartition, is Max(1). This dictates that a LogicalDisk can not span more than one Partition. However, there are cases where this is true. When it occurs, the LogicalDisk is really based on some kind of RAID configuration (for example, a mirror or stripe set). In these scenarios, the LogicalDisk is more correctly BasedOn a StorageVolume. To prevent incorrectly using the LogicalDiskBasedOnPartition association, the Max(1) qualifier was put on the Antecedent reference to the DiskPartition.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Describes the AggregatePExtent in a StorageRedundancyGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AggregatePExtent participating in the RedundancyGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: AggregatePSExtents are BasedOn a single PhysicalExtent. This relationship is made explicit in this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AggregatePSExtent which is built on the PhysicalExtent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: AggregatePSExtents are BasedOn a single AggregatePExtent. This relationship is made explicit in this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AggregatePSExtent which is built on the AggregatePExtent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SnapshotOfExtent is an association between an Extent and its Snapshot. This relationship is made explicit in this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Association indicating that memory is installed and required for the UnitaryComputerSystem to operate. At least one Memory StorageExtent is required. Note that this relationship inherits from the SystemDevice association, and therefore, the Memory StorageExtent is weak to the aggregating UnitaryComputerSystem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Memory StorageExtent which is part of the UnitaryComputerSystem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Associates the Processor and system Memory, or a Processor's Cache.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Speed of the bus, in MHertz, between the Processor and Memory.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Processor that accesses the Memory or uses the Cache.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A link between BIOSElement and NonVolatileStorage where the BIOS is loaded.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BIOS stored in the NonVolatile Extent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ending address where the BIOS is located in non-volatile storage.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The starting address where the BIOS is located in non-volatile storage.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: CIM_DriveInDiskGroup defines the DiskDrive(s) that participate in the Group.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The DiskGroup. A Drive is a member of at most one DiskGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: CIM_ExtentInDiskGroup defines the StorageExtent(s) that are located within and restricted by the Group.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The DiskGroup. An Extent is defined within at most one DiskGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The StorageExtent restricted by and participating in the Group.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: CIM_GroupInDiskGroup describes that a DiskGroup may be divided into smaller named Collections.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The DiskGroup that is subsetted into smaller Collections.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The DiskGroup that is a subset of the larger Group.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: LogicalDevices may have one or more AlarmDevices associated with them, in order to indicate problem situations. This relationship is indicated by the AssociatedAlarm dependency.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Doors provide access to PhysicalElements for hot swap, repair and similar activities. The entities accessed through a Door are indicated in this relationship.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Doors provide access to PhysicalElements for hot swap, repair and similar activities. In turn, PhysicalElements 'Realize' LogicalDevices. Since it may not be possible to define all the PhysicalElements that exist, and optimizing the retrieval of Devices 'behind' the Door may be desirable, the DoorAccessToDevice association provides a shortcut mechanism for defining the LogicalDevices ('hardware') accessed through a Door.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PickerForChanger indicates the PickerElement(s) that access StorageMediaLocations and deliver PhysicalMedia to the Changer, for movement through the System. A Changer may have several Pickers for faster exchange of Media.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PickerElement that accesses StorageMediaLocations to deliver Media to the Changer.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: LibraryExchange indicates that two StorageLibraries are connected through their InterLibraryPorts.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Enumeration indicating whether the Antecedent (value=1), Dependent (value=2), or neither Library (value=3) currently has access to the Port.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The InterLibraryPort of the connected Library.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PickerLabelReader is used to indicate that one or more LabelReaders works in conjunction with PickerElements, to identify PhysicalMedia as they are being picked/placed.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PickerElement that is dependent on the Reader Device.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: AccessLabelReader is used to indicate that one or more LabelReaders works in conjunction with MediaAccessDevices, to identify PhysicalMedia before read/write.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The MediaAccessDevice that is dependent on the Reader Device.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: RecordInLog describes the aggregation or location of Log entries within a MessageLog.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Log entry contained within the MessageLog.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: MessageLogs can reside in data files, on specially allocated storage areas such as disks or memory, or output as raw I/O streams. In fact, a single Log may use each of these mechanisms to output or capture its contents. The LogInDeviceFile association describes a Log outputting to a raw I/O stream DeviceFile - for example, a serial port on a UNIX system.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The MessageLog outputting to the DeviceFile.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: MessageLogs can reside in data files, on specially allocated storage areas such as disks or memory, or output as raw I/O streams. In fact, a single Log may use each of these mechanisms to output or capture its contents. The LogInDataFile association describes a Log stored as a DataFile.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The MessageLog residing in the DataFile.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: MessageLogs can reside in data files, on specially allocated storage areas such as disks or memory, or output as raw I/O streams. In fact, a single Log may use each of these mechanisms to output or capture its contents. The LogInStorage association describes a Log located in a specially allocated portion of a StorageExtent. The offset of the Log, within the Extent, is defined using a property of the association, StartingOffset.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The MessageLog located within the Extent.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: StartingOffset indicates where in the Extent that the Log begins.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ManagedSystemElements may record their event, error or informational data within MessageLogs. The use of a Log to hold a ManagedSystemElement's data is described by this association. The type of Element data captured by the Log can be specified using the RecordedData string property.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ManagedSystemElement whose information is recorded in the MessageLog.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A free-form string describing the use of the Log by the ManagedSystemElement.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PhysicalElementLocation associates a PhysicalElement with a Location object for inventory or replacement purposes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalElement whose Location is specified.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ElementCapacity associates a PhysicalCapacity object with one or more PhysicalElements. It serves to associate a description of min/max hardware requirements or capabilities (stored as a kind of PhysicalCapacity), with the PhysicalElements being described.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PhysicalCapacity describes the minimum and maximum requirements, and ability to support different types of hardware for a PhysicalElement.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: ParticipatesInSet indicates which PhysicalElements should be replaced together.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalElement which should be replaced with other Elements, as a Set.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Racks, as simple enclosures, contain Chassis that provide the physical componentry realizing processing nodes, storage devices, UPSs, etc. The ChassisInRack association makes explicit the 'containing' relationship between the Rack and the Chassis.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An integer indicating the lowest or 'bottom' U in which the Chassis is mounted. A 'U' is a standard unit of measure for the height of a Rack or rack-mountable component. It is equal to 1.75 inches or 4.445 cm.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Rack that contains the Chassis.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Chassis which is mounted in the Rack.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A Chassis can contain other Packages, such as other Chassis and Cards. The PackageInChassis association makes explicit this relationship.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Chassis that contains other PhysicalPackages.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalPackage which is contained in the Chassis.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A laptop, a type of Chassis, may be docked in another type of Chassis, a Docking Station. This is the relationship represented by the Docked association. Because this is such a typical relationship, it is explicitly described.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Cards may be plugged into Motherboards/baseboards, are daughtercards of an adapter, or support special Card-like modules. These relationships are described by the CardOnCard association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Card that hosts another Card.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A string describing and identifying how the Card is mounted on or plugged into the 'other' Card. Slot information could be included in this field and may be sufficient for certain management purposes. If so, this avoids creating instantiations of Connector/Slot objects just to model the relationship of Cards to HostingBoards or other adapters. On the other hand, if Slot and Connector information is available, this field could be used to provide more detailed mounting or slot insertion data.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Card that is plugged into or otherwise mounted on another Card.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Within an automated StorageLibrary, Media should be accessible to the various robotics and MediaTransferDevices (Pickers, Changers, InterLibraryPorts, etc.). The Library may be serviced by different TransferDevices, each responsible for a subset of the Library's StorageMediaLocations. The DeviceServicesLocation association indicates that the TransferDevice handles Media stored in the referenced Location. For example, LibraryPort 'A' may only service Media from Slots 1-10, while LibraryPort 'B' covers Slots 11-33. This detail is conveyed by this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The MediaTransferDevice that handles Media from the StorageMediaLocation.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PhysicalMemory can be located on HostingBoards, adapter Cards, etc. This association explicitly defines this relationship of Memory to Cards.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Card that includes or 'contains' Memory.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalMemory which is located on the Card.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: MemoryWithMedia indicates that Memory is associated with a PhysicalMedia and its cartridge. The Memory provides media identification and also stores user-specific data.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Within a StorageLibrary, all Media should be accounted for, and be present in some Storage Location. This relationship is made explicit by the PhysicalMediaInLocation association.In addition, one can determine if a Location is empty or full based on whether this association exists for the StorageMediaLocation.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The StorageMediaLocation which holds the PhysicalMedia.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PhysicalExtents are realized on a PhysicalMedia. This relationship is made explicit by the RealizesPExtent association. In addition, the StartingAddress of the PhysicalExtent on the PhysicalMedia is specified here.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalMedia on which the Extent is realized.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalExtent that is located on the Media.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: DiskPartitions can be directly realized on a PhysicalMedia. This is used to model the creation of Partitions on a raw SCSI or IDE drive, using the fdisk (DOS and Unix) or pdisk (Unix) command. The StartingAddress of the DiskPartition on the PhysicalMedia is also specified as a property of this relationship. An alternative is that Partitions can be BasedOn StorageVolumes, such as a VolumeSet or a Volume exposed by a hardware RAID cabinet. The latter relationship is modeled using the DiskPartitionBasedOnVolume association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalMedia on which the Extent is realized.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The DiskPartition that is located on the Media.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: AggregatePExtents are realized on a PhysicalMedia. This relationship is made explicit by the RealizesAggregatePExtent association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalMedia on which the Extent is realized.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AggregatePExtent that is located on the Media.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: TapePartitions are realized on PhysicalTape. This relationship is made explicit by the RealizesTapePartition association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalTape on which the Partition is realized.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The TapePartition that is located on the Media.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ElementsLinked association indicates which PhysicalElements are cabled together by a PhysicalLink.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Slots are special types of Connectors into which adapter Cards are typically inserted. The SlotInSlot relationship represents the ability of a special adapter to extend the existing Slot structure to enable otherwise incompatible Cards to be plugged into a Frame or HostingBoard. The adapter effectively creates a new Slot and can be thought of (conceptually) as a Slot in a Slot. This enables Cards that would otherwise be physically and/or electrically incompatible with the existing Slots to be supported, by interfacing to the Slot provided by the adapter. This has many practical uses. For example, networking boards are very expensive. As new hardware becomes available, Chassis and even Card configurations change. To protect the investment of their customers, networking vendors will manufacture special adapters that enable old Cards to fit into new Chassis or HostingBoards and/or new Cards to fit into old. This is done using a special adapter that fits over one or more existing Slots and presents a new Slot into which the Card can plug.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Antecedent represents the existing Slot(s) of the HostingBoard, or Frame that are being adapted to accommodate a Card that would otherwise not be physically and/or electrically compatible with it.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The new Slot provided by the adapter board.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: AdjacentSlots describes the layout of Slots on a HostingBoard or adapter Card. Information like the distance between the Slots and whether they are 'shared' (if one is populated, then the other Slot can not be used), is conveyed as properties of the association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The distance, in inches, between adjacent Slots.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Slots can be located in close proximity on HostingBoards or other Cards, such that if one of these Slots is populated by an adapter Card, the other Slot must be left empty. This relationship is indicated by the SharedSlots boolean set to TRUE.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Slots are special types of Connectors into which adapter Cards are inserted. This relationship of a Card in a Slot is made explicit using the CardInSlot association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Slot into which the Card is inserted.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Cables and Links utilize PhysicalConnectors to actually 'connect' PhysicalElements. This association explicitly defines this relationship of Connectors for PhysicalLinks.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalLink that has a Connector.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PhysicalPackages contain Connectors as well as other PhysicalElements. The ConnectorOnPackage association makes explicit the containment relationship between Connectors and Packages.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalPackage that has a Connector.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AdapterActiveConnection relationship indicates that a NetworkAdapter is using the referenced PhysicalConnector to output to the network. This relationship is important when the Adapter can choose to output from one of several Connectors. The Connectors may be associated with the NetworkAdapter in a Realizes relationship - but this is not required. This association provides additional information (i.e., 'in use for communication') different than Realizes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The NetworkAdapter that transmits using the Connector.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Similar to the way that LogicalDevices are 'Realized' by PhysicalElements, UnitaryComputerSystems are realized in one or more PhysicalPackages. The ComputerSystemPackage association explicitly defines this relationship.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalPackage(s) that realize a UnitaryComputerSystem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A Gloabally Unique Identifier for the System's Package.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Similar to the way that LogicalDevices are 'Realized' by PhysicalElements, a StorageLibrary can be realized in one or more PhysicalPackages. The LibraryPackage association explicitly defines this relationship.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalPackage(s) that realize a StorageLibrary.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Often, a CoolingDevice is installed in a Package such as a Chassis or a Rack, not for a specific Device, but to assist in the cooling of the Package in general. This relationship is described by the PackageCooling association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalPackage whose environment is cooled.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Often, a TemperatureSensor is installed in a Package such as a Chassis or a Rack, not to measure any particular Device, but the Package's environment in general. This relationship is described by the PackageTempSensor association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalPackage whose environment is monitored.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Often, an AlarmDevice is installed as part of a Package, not to indicate issues with any particular LogicalDevice or PhysicalComponent, but with the Package's environment in general, its security state or its overall health. This relationship is described by the PackageAlarm association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PhysicalPackage whose health, security, environment, etc. is alarmed.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of the CIM_HostedService association that establishes dependency relationships between an administrative domain and the NetworkServices that it hosts. This also has the semantics that this set of services are commonly administered.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AdminDomain that aggregates the various network services and administers them.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The network service that is hosted in the administrative domain.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A LogicalNetworkService represents network services that either originate and/or terminate in a LogicalNetwork. This enables management applications to more easily identify services that are provided by particular network devices.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An enumeration that explicitly defines this network service as originating, terminating, or residing in this LogicalNetwork.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The LogicalNetwork that contains the network service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The NetworkService that is running in the LogicalNetwork.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association represents the dependency that exists between the ProtocolEndpoints that are used to forward data and the ForwardingService that is performing the forwarding of data.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ProtocolEndpoints that are used to forward the data

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The service that is forwarding the data

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Defines a LANEndpoint as a member of a specific LANSegment.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The LANSegment that groups the LANEndpoint instances.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A child LANEndpoint that is a component of the LANSegment.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association defines a connection that is currently carrying traffic between two ProtocolEndpoints.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A ProtocolEndpoint in active communication with the dependent ProtocolEndpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A second ProtocolEndpoint communicating with the Antecedent ProtocolEndpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: TRUE means that this connection is uni-directional; FALSE means that this connection is bi-directional.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A string describing the type of traffic that is being carried over this instance when its Type property is set to 1 (e.g., 'Other'). The format of the string inserted in this property should be similar in format to the values defined for the TrafficType property. This property should be set to NULL when the TrafficType property is any value other than 1.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The type of traffic that is carried over this connection.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This assocation makes explicit the routes that are used by a specific ForwardingService. Thus, every ForwardingService can have its own unique set of routing destinations.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This property contains the current administrative distance of this route. Note that the AdministrativeDistance class contains the default values, not the current values, of administrative distances that are to be used with routes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This contains an integer which provides an indication as to the preference of this route compared to other routes that reach the same destination.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association makes explicit the dependency of a ProtocolEndpoint on some lower layer ProtocolEndpoint on the same system.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This describes the framing method for the upper layer protocol endpoint that is bound to a LANEndpoint. Note: "Raw802.3" is only known to be used with the IPX protocol.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association defines a BGP route, and makes explicit the dependency between a BGPIPRoute and a BGPProtocolEndpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPProtocolEndpoints that represent the source and destination (or at least the next hop) of the BGP route.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The routing table entry that represents a BGP route.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association is used to define the set of LogicalNetworks that it contains. This has the implied semantics that this set of LogicalNetworks are all administered by the same network administrator that administrates the AdminDomain.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AdminDomain that hosts the various LogicalNetworks.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The LogicalNetworks that are hosted by the AdminDomain.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This aggregation establishes 'whole-part' relationships between a BGPCluster and the ComputerSystems (e.g., the routers) that it contains. At least three routers are required to form a cluster - a reflector and two clients. In addition, the routers that form a cluster share common configuration information, and are commonly administered.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Cluster that aggregates the routers belonging to it and administers them.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The routers that form the Cluster.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This aggregation establishes 'whole-part' relationships between an AutonomousSystem and the BGPClusters that it In addition, the routers that form a cluster share common configuration information, and are commonly administered.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AutonomousSystem that aggregates the Clusters belonging to it and administers them.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Clusters that are contained in the AS.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This aggregation establishes 'whole-part' relationships between an AutonomousSystem and the routers that it contains. In addition, the routers in the AS share common configuration information, and are commonly administered.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: TRUE means that the community value of this router is added to the existing community value, and FALSE means that the community value of this router replaces the existing community value.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is an array of strings that contain the BGP attributes supported by this router.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AutonomousSystem that aggregates the routers belonging to it and administers them.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A string describing the type of function that this router has in its AS when the value of the Role property of this class is set to 1 (e.g., 'Other'). The format of the string inserted in this property should be similar in format to the values defined for the Role property. This property should be set to NULL when the Role property is any value other than 1.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Routers that are contained in the AS.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is an enumeration that defines the function, from the point of view of BGP, of this router.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association represents the endpoints that a network service provides to access it.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The NetworkService that is being accessed by the ProtocolEndpoints.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The ProtocolEndpoints that provide access to the NetworkService.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This aggregation defines the different router interfaces that are running BGP in the AutonomousSystem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AutonomousSystem that aggregates the router interfaces that are running BGP.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The router interfaces that are contained in the AS.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGP speakers in an AS are required to be fully meshed. This can lead to a huge number of TCP connections per router. One way to reduce the peering requirements is to use a confederation. A confederation effectively partitions one AS into a group of 'sub-ASs'. This enables all of the benefits of IBGP to be applied inside the confederation, while enabling EBGP to be run between each confederation. This enables certain BGP attribute values to be preserved between confederations. However, to the outside world, the AS with its confederations appear to be a single AS.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A unique identifier of the Confederation within the AutonomousSystem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The AutonomousSystem that contains the confederations.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A unique identifier of the AutonomousSystem that contains the confederations.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This assocation makes explicit the routes that are calculated by a specific RouteCalculationService. Thus, every RouteCalculationService can have its own unique set of calculated routes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of CIM_HostedService, which is anassociation between a Service and the System on which the functionality resides. The ComputerSystem is made up of different routing services, which take the form of internal and external routing protocols. These are different NetworkServices, and are weak with respect to their hosting ComputerSystem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Service hosted on the System.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of CIM_HostedService, which is anassociation between a Service and the System on which the functionality resides. The ComputerSystem is made up of different forwarding services, which take the form of internal and external routing protocols. These are different NetworkServices, and are weak with respect to their hosting ComputerSystem.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Service hosted on the System.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of ServiceServiceDependency, and captures the dependency that external gateway protocols (such as BGP) have on interior gateway protocols (such as OSPF).

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The independent RouteCalculationService (e.g., the RouteCalculationService that is functioning as an EGP.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The dependent RouteCalculationService that provides routing information within an AS for the RouteCalculationService that is functioning as an EGP to use.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Sometimes it is necessary to inject EGP information, such as that from BGP, into IGPs. This attribute defines whether this should be done for the two routing protocols that are defined by this association. The values below mean that no, partial, and full EGP information is injected into the IGP, respectively.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association will serve as the base class for defining BGP routing policies for the reflector of this Cluster.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Cluster for which this policy is being defined.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPService to which the policy will be applied in the Cluster.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association will serve as the base class for defining BGP routing policies for clients of the reflector of this Cluster.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Cluster for which this policy is being defined.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPService to which the policy will be applied in the Cluster.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association will serve as the base class for defining BGP routing policies for the non-clients of the reflector of this Cluster.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Cluster for which this policy is being defined.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPService to which the policy will be applied in the Cluster.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of the CIM_Component aggregation which is used to define a set of FilterEntries that are aggregated by a particular FilterList.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The FilterList, which aggregates the set of FilterEntries.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A FilterEntry, which is part-of the FilterList.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The position of the FilterEntry relative to all other entries in the FilterList.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of the CIM_Component aggregation which is used to define a set of FilterLists that are aggregated by a particular RoutingPolicy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The RoutingPolicy, which aggregates the set of FilterLists.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A FilterList, which is part-of the RoutingPolicy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: the position of the FilterList relative to all other entries in the RoutingPolicy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of the Dependency association, and defines the relationship between a BGPService and the RoutingPolicy that control it.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPService that is controlled by the routing policy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This defines the relationship between a BGPService and the BGP Peer Group that hosts it.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGP Peer Group that hosts the BGP Service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPService that is hosted in the BGP Peer Group.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of the Dependency association, and defines the relationship between a BGPService and the Administrative Distances that it uses to control the (BGP) routing decisions that it makes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The table of (global) administrative distances that are used by all BGP services.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGP service object, that makes BGP routing decisions.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This aggregation defines the RouteMaps that are used by a particular RoutingPolicy object. Multiple instances of the same RouteMap may be used in the same RoutingPolicy instance; if this is desired, then the Sequence attribute of this aggregation can be used to disambiguate them.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The RoutingPolicy that aggregates the RouteMaps.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The RouteMaps that are used by the RoutingPolicy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This defines the position of this RouteMap instance relative to all other instances of the same RouteMap.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association defines the RouteMaps that are used by a particular BGPPeerGroup object. Multiple instances of the same RouteMap may be used in the same BGPPeerGroup instance; if this is desired, then the Sequence attribute of this association can be used to disambiguate them.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPPeerGroup that aggregates the RouteMaps.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The RouteMaps that are used by the BGPPeerGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This defines the position of this RouteMap instance relative to all other instances of the same RouteMap.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: RouteMaps do not have to use FilterLists, but if they do, this association defines which FilterList is used by a particular RouteMap.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The FilterList used by a RouteMap.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This aggregation defines the specific routers (e.g., ComputerSystems) that participate in a PeerGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PeerGroup that aggregates the routers.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The routers that comprise the PeerGroup.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of the ServiceSAPDependency association, indicating that the referenced ProtocolEndpoint is utilized by the RouteCalculationService to provide its functionality.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The RouteCalculationService, which is dependent on the underlying ProtocolEndpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: TRUE indicates that this ProtocolEndpoint represents a static route, and FALSE means that it represents a dynamically-learned route.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of the Component aggregation, which is used to define the set of BGP Attributes that are used by a particular Routing Policy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The RoutingPolicy, which aggregates a set of BGP attributes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A BGP attribute, which is part-of the RoutingPolicy.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This defines the attributes that are transmitted between BGP peers on a per-route basis.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPIPRoute that may have an associated set of per-peer attributes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPPathAttribute object that may be associated with a BGP route.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An IP address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field. This object is an IP address containing the prefix with length specified by the PathAttrIpAddrPrefixLen attribute.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This defines the length in bits of the IP address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability information field. The range of this attribute is defined to be 0 to 32.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This defines the IP address of the peer where the path information was learned.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This is a specialization of the Component aggregation. This aggregation defines the set of BGP Attributes that are transmitted in per-path UPDATE messages.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPService that aggregates BGP attributes as part of its routing information.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGP attribute, which are part-of the BGP UPDATE message.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A SwitchService switches frames between SwitchPorts. This association makes that relationship explicit.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A switch port has a LANEndpoint that is exposed via this relationship.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A switch participating in the spanning tree maintains spanning-tree specific information about each port whose forwarding is determined by the spanning tree. This association represents that information.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The bridge identifier of the designated bridge for the segment to which the port is attached.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The cost of the path to the root offered by the designated bridge for the segment.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The port identifier of the port on the designated bridge serving the segment to which the port is attached.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The bridge identifier of the root bridge for the segment to which the port is attached, as transmitted by the designated bridge for the segment.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The enabled/disabled status of the port.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The contribution of this port to the path cost of paths towards the spanning tree root which include this port.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The priority assigned to the port. Contained in the first octet of the two-octet port ID; the other octet is the port number.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The current state of the port as determined by the spanning tree protocol.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association links an instance of the transparent bridging service to the entries of its forwarding database. The forwarding database is weak to the service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Dynamic Forwarding Entry of forwarding database.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association links a dynamic forwarding entry and the switch port to which the entry applies.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Dynamic Forwarding Entry of forwarding database.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association links an instance of the transparent bridging service to the entries of its static (destination-address filtering) database.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Static Forwarding Entry of forwarding database.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association links a static database entry and the switch port to which the entry applies.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Static Forwarding Entry of static database.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An association linking SwitchService to a component TransparentBridgingService. The cardinality of the TransparentBridgingService is 0..1 for a VLAN-unaware switch.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An association linking SwitchService to a component SpanningTreeService. The cardinality of the SpanningTreeService is 0..1 for a VLAN-unaware switch.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An association linking SwitchService to a component SourceRoutingService. The cardinality of the SourceRoutingService is 0..1 for a VLAN-unaware switch.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association represents information regarding port pairings that is used by the SourceRoutingService of a switch.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A bridge number that uniquely identifies the path provided by this source routing bridge between the segments connected to high and low ports. The purpose of bridge number is to disambiguate between multiple paths connecting the same two LANs.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The state of dot1dPortPairBridgeNum. Writing 'invalid(3)' to this property removes the association instance.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A switch capable of source routing maintains source-routing specific information about each port. This association represents that information.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: A bridge number uniquely identifies a bridge when more than one bridge is used to span the same two segments. Current source routing protocols limit this value to the range: 0 through 15. A value of 65535 signifies that no bridge number is assigned to this bridge.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The maximum number of routing descriptors allowed in an All Paths or Spanning Tree Explorer frames.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The segment number that uniquely identifies the segment to which this port is connected. Current source routing protocols limit this value to the range: 0 through 4095. (The value 0 is used by some management applications for special test cases.) A value of 65535 signifies that no segment number is assigned to this port.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Determines how the port behaves when presented with a Spanning Tree Explorer frame. The value 'disabled(2)' indicates that the port will not accept or send Spanning Tree Explorer packets; any STE packets received will be silently discarded. The value 'forced(3)' indicates the port will always accept and propagate Spanning Tree Explorer frames. This allows a manually configured Spanning Tree for this class of packet to be configured. Note that unlike transparent bridging, this is not catastrophic to the network if there are loops. The value 'auto-span(1)' can only be returned by a bridge that both implements the Spanning Tree Protocol and has use of the protocol enabled on this port. The behavior of the port for Spanning Tree Explorer frames is determined by the value of the State property of the SwitchPortSpanningTree association for the port. If the port is in the 'forwarding' state, the frame will be accepted or propagated. Otherwise, it will be silently discarded.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The segment number that corresponds to the target segment this port is considered to be connected to by the switch. Current source routing protocols limit this value to the range: 0 through 4095. (The value 0 is used by some management applications for special test cases.) A value of 65535 signifies that no target segment is assigned to this port.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The association between a VLAN and the forwarding database(some use the term filtering database) used to determinewhich port a packet should be transmitted on, given that itis assigned to the VLAN and that it has a particulardestination MAC address. The TransparentBridgingServicerepresents a forwarding database.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association identifies the spanning tree in whicha forwarding database (TransparentBridgingService) isnested.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE:
This association makes explicit the operational dependencies of a SwitchPort when operating in a VLAN.
If there is an association between a particular SwitchPort and a particular VLAN, then there is the possibility that a packet received by the port will be assigned to the VLAN (or if the packet already has a VLAN tag, that the packet will not be dropped). If there is no such association, then there is no possibility that a packet received by the port will progress through the switch having been assigned to the VLAN in question.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Default should be true if untagged packets received by the SwitchPort are assigned to the VLAN by default. For 802.1Q-compliant ports, the Default property should be true on the association instance connecting a SwitchPort to the CIM_VLAN corresponding to the port's PVID. Default should never be true if Tagged is true -- it applies only to untagged packets.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE:
If true, packets already tagged with this VLAN number will beaccepted when arriving at this port. For example, if there isan InboundVLAN association between port 12 and VLAN 7 forwhich Tagged is true, then if a packet tagged with VLAN 7arrives at port 12, the packet will be accepted into theswitch for further processing. If there is no such association, then the packet will be dropped.
If false, it means that any untagged packets arriving at thisport MIGHT be classified into the associated VLAN. If, for aparticular SwitchPort, there is only one instance of theassociation for which Tagged is false, then all incominguntagged packets will be classified into that VLAN. This isthe typical configuration of a non-trunk port in a switchimplementing port-based VLANs. If there is more than one suchassociation instance, then the packet MIGHT be classifiedinto any one of them, based on some criterion other than theidentity of the switch port. For example, in a MAC-based VLAN switch, the decision would be based on the source MAC address. In a protocol-based VLAN switch, the decision would be based on the values of some set of bits in the packet.
Note that the MAC address is formatted as twelve hexadecimal digits (e.g., "010203040506"), with each pair representing one of the six octets of the MAC address in "canonical" bit order according to RFC 2469.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE:
This association makes explicit the operational dependencies of a SwitchPort when operating in a VLAN.
If there is no instance of OutboundVLAN between a given SwitchPort and CIM_VLAN, then any packet that has been assigned to the VLAN and whose destination address is associated with the port will be dropped by the switch without being transmitted. Otherwise, the packet will be transmitted.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: If Tagged is true, then the packet will be transmitted inencapsulated form, tagged with the associated VLAN tag. IfTagged is false, the packet will be trasmitted without anyVLAN tag.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An association linking SwitchService to a component VLANService.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The VLAN Port used by the VLAN Service.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association defines statistics collected for a BGP session.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The BGPService for which statistics are being gathered.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The statistics object for the BGP session.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: CIM_EndpointIdentity indicates that two ProtocolEndpoints represent different aspects of the same underlying address or protocol-specific ID. This association refines the CIM_LogicalIdentity superclass by restricting it to the Endpoint level and defining its use in well understood scenarios. One of these scenarios is to represent that an Endpoint has both 'LAN' and protocol-specific aspects. For example, an Endpoint could be both a LANEndpoint as well as a DHCPEndpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SameElement represents an alternate aspect of the Endpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: SystemElement represents one aspect of the Endpoint.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An association that describes the metrics that are associated with a Unit Of Work definition.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The Unit of Work definition where the metrics apply.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The metric definitions for a particular unit of work.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association describes the metrics and their values for an instance of a Unit of Work that has started executing.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The unit of work that has metrics.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The metric definition for this particular value.The metric definition must be associated via a UoWMetricDefinitionto the same UoWMetricDefinition to which the UnitOfWork is weaklyassociated.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The value of the data. The type of the data is described by themetric definition. The data type here is string so it can handle any type of data.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association links a unit of work to its defintion.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The definition object for the unit of work.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: An instance of a unit of work that has started executing.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association links a logical element to the units of work that can be performed by the element. For example, a printer can have a printjob unit of work definition defined.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The logical element that is providing the unit of work.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The unit of work definition associated with the LogicalElement.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association defines the sub-units of work (sub-transactions) for a particular unit of work. For example, an 'Add_Order' unit of work could have sub-units of work of 'ValidateCustomer', 'ValidatePartNumber' 'UpdateDatabase', etc...

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The parent unit of work definition.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association identifies the unit of work withthe logical element that is performing the work.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The logical element performing the unit of work.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: This association identifies the executed sub-unit of work (sub-transaction) with its parent unit of work.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PRS_SolutionHasElement is an abstract base class for associating PRS_Solution with objects derived from PRS_SolutionElement. This association class allows all PRS_Reference, PRS_Problem and PRS_Resolution objects to be retrieved with a single query.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PRS_Reference, PRS_Problem or PRS_Resolution aggregated into the Solution by this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PRS_Solution root object of the Solution.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PRS_SolutionReference aggregates a Reference into a Solution.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PRS_Reference aggregated into the Solution.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PRS_SolutionProblem aggregates a Problem into a Solution.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PRS_Problem aggregated into the Solution.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PRS_SolutionResolution aggregates a Resolution into a Solution.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PRS_Solution aggregated into the Solution.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PRS_SolutionCategory associates PRS_Solution with a PRS_Category for classification purposes.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The specific PRS_Category being used to classify the Solution.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PRS_Categorization associates PRS_Reference, PRS_Problem or PRS_Resolution with a PRS_Category for classification purposes. For example, a Category named 'Printing Issues' can be defined for a Problem using the Categorization association between a PRS_Problem and a PRS_Category.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The specific PRS_Reference, PRS_Problem or PRS_Resolution classified by this association.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PRS_CategoryParentChild is used to define classification hierarchies.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The child PRS_Category used for classification.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The parent PRS_Category used for classification.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Associates PRS_Expression with PRS_ExpressionElements such as PRS_Expression, PRS_Product, and PRS_Statement.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The child PRS_ExpressionElement. Either PRS_Expression, PRS_Product or PRS_Statement.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Products may exist in a hierarchy of relationships with related Products. If a Producer deems these hierarchy relationships are relevant to the current Problem or Resolution, then the position of the Product in a hierarchy can be implied using one of two types of relationships: 'is a' and 'has a'. An 'is a' relationship implies a classification, such as versioning or typing. A 'has a' relationship implies that one product contains another. The PRS_ProductParentChild association is used to imply an 'is a' hierarchy. Use the ProductComponent association to imply 'has a' relationships.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PRS_ProductComponent is used to describe 'has a' relationships between Products and their components parts. See PRS_ProductParentChild for 'is a' relationships.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PRS_Product which contains the component.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PRS_ProductAsset is used to provide specific information about a PRS_Product. PRS_ProductAsset associates this information to a PRS_Product using one or more Statements associated to a PRS_Expression.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Associates PRS_Feature with PRS_Resource. Used to track specific labor and costs associated with specific tasks defined in Feature objects.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Associates PRS_SolutionElements (PRS_Reference, PRS_Problem or PRS_Resolution) with PRS_Expression.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Associates PRS_Administrative with any object derived from PRS_ExchangeElement.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Abstract root class to associate PRS_Person or PRS_Organization and PRS_Contact.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PRS_ContactItem, either PRS_Person or PRS_Organization. There is always at least one PRS_ContactItem, however it may be either a PRS_Person or PRS_Organization. For that reason, there is a minimum cardinality of one for this property, but a minimum cardinality of zero in the classes derived from this class.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: PRS_ServiceRequester associates a PRS_Service Incident with a PRS_Contact representing the entity requesting service. Note that the Contact class is used for both Requesters and Providers, the context is determined by which association exists.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Associates PRS_ServiceIncident to PRS_Contact to describe the Service Provider.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Associates PRS_ServiceIncident to PRS_Problem to describe the Problem being submitted to the Service Provider.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: Associates PRS_ServiceIncident to PRS_Solution to describe the Resolutions proposed by the Service Provider.

QUALIFIER.NAME: Description
QUALIFIER.VALUE: The PRS_Solution. PRS_Solution must be associated with at least one Resolution.
